revised_title: The Continuity of Gaseous and Liquid States of Matter: A Study on Carbonic Acid
tldr: The author investigates the continuity between the gaseous and liquid states of matter, specifically focusing on carbonic acid. By applying high pressure and varying temperatures, Andrews demonstrates that carbonic acid can be partially liquefied, and discusses the implications of this finding on the understanding of phase transitions and the properties of gases and liquids.
